abstract: Shares on Wall Street pulled back from their recent winning streak on Wednesday amid concerns about debt problems in Portugal and disappointing home sales in the United States.
snippet: Shares on Wall Street pulled back from their recent winning streak on Wednesday amid concerns about debt problems in Portugal and disappointing home sales in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Shares on Wall Street pulled back from their recent winning streak on Wednesday amid concerns about debt problems in Portugal and disappointing home sales in the United States, The New York Times’s David Jolly and Javier C. Hernandez reported.

headline.main: Shares Fall on Worries About Sales and Europe Debt
